data.title: Welcome to City of Blue Ash, Ohio
data.meta_description: Welcome to City of Blue Ash, Ohio
data.text:
Explore Blue Ash

Visit the Observation Tower at Summit Park for breathtaking views of the surrounding areas! The tower is temporarily closed, learn more about the construction project.

If you're a visitor in the City of Blue Ash, make sure to give yourself time to explore the wonderful amenities offered here. From hitting a hole-in-one at an award-winning golf course, rocking out at free concerts, dining at unique restaurants and even going sky-high in the City's Observation Tower - there is something for everyone.

Where should you begin? Here are a few of our favorite things:

Schedule a tee time at the Blue Ash Golf Course:

Golf Digest magazine has rated the award-winning Blue Ash Golf Course as one of its top 75 municipal golf courses in the United States – out of approximately 10,000 such courses! Recently, the Course was proven again as a favorite public course within the Cincinnati area as it was chosen as the “reader’s pick” by the Cincinnati-based magazine City Beat . It was also voted "Best of the North" by the readers of Cincinnati Magazine as their favorite course, multiple times. It was host to the 107th Tony Blom Metropolitan Championship in 2016. The 18-hole, 6,800 yard par 72 championship layout will challenge even the most discriminating golfer. The golf course is open year-round, weather permitting. (Photo by Terrence Huge)

Reach new heights at Summit Park's Observation Tower:

The tower’s glass elevator takes visitors to the 125 foot Observation Deck, where they can see downtown Cincinnati, King Island’s Eiffel Tower and other familiar landmarks. For a beautiful overview of the park, visitors can also choose to enjoy the lower Observation Deck at 26 feet. Both decks are secure with glass barriers and safe for children.

The Observation Tower is currently open daily from noon – 9:00 p.m., with plans to expand operating hours in the near future. There is no charge to visit the Observation Tower. Food, drink, pets and strollers are prohibited.

Enjoy a free concert:

From regional traditions such as Red, White & Blue Ash to smaller events including the Summer Concert Series, Blue Ash is full of fun, free and family-friendly events!

Relax at one of the City's many unique restaurants:

The City of Blue Ash is home to a wide variety of restaurants, including Summit Park favorites Senate, Brown Dog Cafe, TAHONA Kitchen + Bar and Nanny Belle's Ice cream. Blue Ash also has popular microbreweries Fretboard Brewing Company and Queen City Brewery.

These are just a sample of the many great things happening in Blue Ash each and every day! Click through the tabs to discover more!
